results.title: Sony Handycam DCR-SX65
results.brief_description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 debuted in 1985 and while other models from the era have been discontinued, it’s been made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but camcorders like this have captured footage that has social and political ramifications.

constellations_primary.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_primary.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 is what it says: it’s a handy camera. Debuting on the market in 1985, its name came from its compact size that allowed it to fit in the user’s hand and capture their everyday lives more easily. While other models from this era have been discontinued, the Sony Handycam DCR-SX65’s popularity has seen it made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but their cost and convivence meant camcorders like this have been used to capture amateur footage that has social and political ramifications all around the world.
description_for_label: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 is what it says: it’s a handy camera. results.title: Hi 5: It's a Hi 5 Christmas
results.creator_credit: Gary Newhnam, Ian Munro, Russell Burton, Alisa Smeaton, Kids Like Us and Nine Films and Television
results.brief_description: A Hi5 Christmas extravaganza! The usual features of a Hi5 television program with the bonus of a live Christmas concert performed in front of an audience at the Sidney Myer Music Bowl in Melbourne. Can be viewed by pressing Play or by selecting the profiles for each group member: Charli, Nathan, Kathleen, Tim or Kellie. Includes “Body move”, “Shapes in space”, “Puzzles and patterns”, “Making music” and “Word play”. Suitable for very young children or early primary school age. Created by Helena Harris and Posie Graeme-Evans.

results.title: What women want
results.creator_credit: Nancy Meyers, Bruce Davey, Gina Matthews, Matt Williams, Susan Cartonis, Centropolis Effects, ICON, Paramount Pictures and Wind Dancer Productions
results.brief_description: Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is a real ladies man. Raised by his mother, a Las Vegas showgirl, he has a somewhat distorted perception of what women really want, and an enormous ego. When he is passed over for an executive position in the advertising agency for a woman his chauvinistic attitude worsens. A freak accident while trying to brainstorm ideas for a new advertising campaign, leaves Nick with the ability to hear what women think. Amazed by his new talent Nick seeks the help of a therapist (Bette Midler) who suggests he think of it as a gift and not a curse, and to use this to his advantage. Nick sets his sights on Darcy McGuire (Helen Hunt), the new creative director in the agency. At first his plan works, and he undermines Darcy at every opportunity, until he realises Darcy has feelings for him, and that he feels the same way about her. Cast also includes Marisa Tomei, Mark Feurstein, Lauren Holly, Valerie Perrine, Delta Bourke and Alan Alda

results.title: The Matrix [DVD]
results.creator_credit: The Wachowskis, Andrew Mason, Joel Silver, Groucho II Film Partnership and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Question that drives us all - What is the Matrix? “Do you believe in fate?” “No, I don’t like to know that I am not in control of my life” “You feel that something is wrong but you don’t know what it is. The world that has been pulled over your eyes, that is to blind you to the Truth. I am offering you “The Truth” - nothing more”. These are the questions at the beginning of a film which stretches the imagination, makes you contemplate your own reality and sense of self. Just like Alice in Wonderland following the white rabbit, so too do we follow Neo (Keanu Reeves) to a new and different reality led by Morpheus (Laurence Fishburne). Along this path we meet Trinity (Carrie-Anne Moss), Switch, Cypher (Joe Pantoliano), The Oracle (Gloria Foster) and the ubiquitous Agent Smith (Hugo Weaving), all who assist/interact with Neo to make sense of the original question - What is The Matrix? No-one can conceive it, no-one can be told what it is. It has to be seen to be understood.

results.title: The Silent feminists: America's first women directors
results.creator_credit: Anthony Slide, Jeffrey Goodman and Film Arts Foundation
results.brief_description: This is a history of women directors in Hollywood where, during the silent era, they had a greater presence. With the aid of interviews and film clips, pioneering women in Hollywood such as Alice Guy Blache, Lois Weber and Dorothy Arzner are remembered.

results.title: Where angels fear to tread
results.creator_credit: Charles Sturridge, Derek Granger, LWT, Sovereign Picture and Stage Screen Productions
results.brief_description: An adaptation of E.M. Forster’s novel of romance and revenge, starring Helen Mirren, Helena Bonham-Carter, Rupert Graves, Judy Davis and Giovanni Guidelli. While visiting Italy with her companion Caroline, widowed Lilia Herriton is enraptured not only by the countryside but by a younger handsome Tuscan who seduces her. The incident outrages her family and in-law Philip Herriton arrives to end the affair but it is too late as the couple are married. After a tragedy occurs, Philip and his sister embark on another mission; to bring back the couple’s infant son. A tug-of-war ensues between father and family.

results.title: Funny business
results.creator_credit: David Hinton, Sarah Williams and Tiger Television
results.brief_description: Rowan Atkinson knows his rubber face and gangly limbs are his tools of trade. The exaggerated gestures, tortured twitch of an eyebrow or deadpan expression guaranteed the phenomenal success of “Not the Nine O’Clock News”, “Black Adder” and “Mr. Bean”. There is however an art to being funny, and as mime artist Kevin Bartholomew (dressed in a lime green skin-tight body suit) the amazing rubber-faced one shows us, along with fellow comedy masters including John Cleese and Peter Sellers, that there is comedy potential in every part of the human anatomy.

results.title: [Darcy Prendergast's Light Pen Animation]
results.brief_description: Animator Darcy Prendergast was commissioned by ACMI to make some light-hearted works – representing film, TV and games – for display on screens throughout the ACMI building. Using his lightpen technique and combining computer animated movement with real-life locations, the films are a ‘hat-tip’ to the internationally popular feature films and characters of the Australian film industry.

results.title: Free Willy 2: the adventure home
results.creator_credit: Dwight Little, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler, Donner Productions and Shuler-Donner
results.brief_description: Jesse is reunited with his Orca friend Willy who has rejoined his family in the wild. Willy becomes trapped by an oil spill fire and Jesse is determined to rescue Willy even if it means risking his own life. Action packed adventure with superb photography, this is a film to be shared by all the family and lovers of whales.
